content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 08 Jul 2019Hi, Considering investing in ALLIANZ INCOME AND GROWTH CL AM DIS H2-SGD. Any feedback on these?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 08 Jul 2019It's a decent fund. It's a multi asset US specific fund that invests in High Yield Bonds, Converticle Bonds, and US Equities hedged to the Singapore Dollar and distributes dividends monthly.Current annualized dividend yield is 8.43%. Fund has grown 7.22% on a compounded basis since inception in July 2013. The all in fund management fee is 1.5% which is pretty standard of Actively Managed Unit Trusts.Just note that fund should be quite sensitive to interest rates and default risk due to nature of the high yield bonds.
A great addition to your portfolio if you're looking for dividends and some long term growth and bullish on the US economy.0 comments3
